intro: Caperonia castrobarrosiana, commonly known as the Castrobarrosian heather, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, shrub-like structure. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
